channel.title: Need help with my compiler, What do I need to do? [Please detail]
channel.description:
Now my compiler has been bugging with this message saying this
[code]Compiling..... Note: Some input files use or override a deprecated API. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. Compiling Finished. Press any key to continue . . .[/code]
Now its simple it wants me to use "-Xlint:deprecation" yet I have no clue what that is
Heres my compiler code if you think I need to make changes its a delta compiler if you wonder or if it even matters
[code]@echo off :menu title StormyNight compiler @echo Compiling..... if exist "%programfiles%\Java" (call :compile "%programfiles%\Java\") else (goto error) :compile for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe") if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java) if defined p (goto end) :error echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load. "%programfiles%\InternetExplorer\iexplore.exe" http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp :end echo Compiling Finished. pause exit [/code]

item.title: Need help with my compiler, What do I need to do? [Please detail]
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

MrFun:

So how do I get “–Xlint:deprecation” can I have a link to it?

It will always say that, until you replace the deprecated methods.

javac --Xlint:deprecation yoursourcefiles.java

Read full topic
item.source: Need help with my compiler, What do I need to do? [Please detail]

item.title: Need help with my compiler, What do I need to do? [Please detail]
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

It means some of your classes are using methods or classes that are deprecated, which means outdated and unsupported. Recompiling with the “-Xlint:deprecation” will show you what’s deprecated.

Read full topic
item.source: Need help with my compiler, What do I need to do? [Please detail]
